summary: The ballerina/ftp module provides an FTP client and an FTP server listener implementation to facilitate an FTP connection to a remote location.
description:
Module Overview

The ballerina/ftp module provides an FTP client and an FTP server listener implementation to facilitate an FTP connection to a remote location.

###FTP Client

The ftp:Client connects to an FTP server and performs various operations on the files. Currently, it supports the generic FTP operations; get, delete, put, append, mkdir, rmdir, isDirectory, rename, size, and list.

An FTP client endpoint is defined using the parameters protocol and host, and optionally the port and secureSocket. Authentication configuration can be configured using the secureSocket parameter for basicAuth, private key, or TrustStore/Keystore.

Creating a client

The following code creates an FTP client and perform I/O operations, which connects to the FTP server with Basic Auth.

import ballerina/ftp;

// Define FTP client configuration
ftp:ClientEndpointConfig ftpConfig = {
    protocol: ftp:FTP,
    host: "<The FTP host>",
    port: <The FTP port>,
    secureSocket: {
        basicAuth: {
            username: "<The FTP username>",
            password: "<The FTP passowrd>"
        }
    }
};

// Create FTP client
ftp:Client ftpClient = new(ftpConfig);
Creating a directory

The following code creates a directory in the remote FTP server.

error? mkdirResponse = ftpClient->mkdir("<The directory path>");
if (mkdirResponse is error) {
    log:printError("Error occured in creating directory", mkdirResponse);
    return;
}
Uploading file to a remote server

The following code uploads a file to a remote FTP server.

io:ReadableByteChannel|error summaryChannel
    = io:openReadableFile("<The local data source path>");
if(summaryChannel is io:ReadableByteChannel){
    error? putResponse = ftpClient->put("<The resource path>", summaryChannel);   
    if(putResponse is error) {
        log:printError("Error occured in uploading content", putResponse);
        return;
    }
}
Compressing and uploading a file to a remote server

The following code compresses and uploads a file to a remote FTP server.

io:ReadableByteChannel|error inputChannel
    = io:openReadableFile("<Local data source path>");
if (inputChannel is io:ReadableByteChannel) {
    // Set the optional boolean flag as 'true' to compress before uploading
    error? compressedPutResponse = ftpClient->put("<Resource path>",
        inputChannel, true);   
    if (compressedPutResponse is error) {
        log:printError("Error occured in uploading content",
            compressedPutResponse);
        return;
    }
}
Getting the size of a remote file

The following code get and size of a file of a file in remote FTP server.

var sizeResponse = ftpClient->size("<The resource path>");
if (sizeResponse is int) {
    log:printInfo("File size: " + sizeResponse.toString());
} else {
    log:printError("Error occured in retrieving size", sizeResponse);
    return;
}
Reading the content of a remote file

The following code read the content of a file in remote FTP server.

var getResponse = ftpClient->get("<The file path>");
if (getResponse is io:ReadableByteChannel) {
    io:ReadableCharacterChannel? characters
        = new io:ReadableCharacterChannel(getResponse, "utf-8");
    if (characters is io:ReadableCharacterChannel) {
        var output = characters.read(<No of characters to read>);
        if (output is string) {
            log:printInfo("File content: " + output);
        } else {
            log:printError("Error occured in retrieving content", output);
            return;
        }
        var closeResult = characters.close();
        if (closeResult is error) {
            log:printError("Error occurred while closing the channel",
                closeResult);
            return;
        }
    }
} else {
    log:printError("Error occured in retrieving content", getResponse);
    return;
}
Renaming or moving a remote file to another remote location in a same FTP server

The following rename or move remote a file to another location in the same remote FTP server.

error? renameResponse = ftpClient->rename("<The source file path>",
    "<The destination file path>");
if (renameResponse is error) {
    log:printError("Error occurred while renaming the file", renameResponse);
    return;
}
Deleting a remote file

The following delete a remote file in a remote FTP server.

error? deleteResponse = ftpClient->delete("<The resource path>");
if (deleteResponse is error) {
    log:printError("Error occurred while deleting a file", deleteResponse);
    return;
}
Removing a directory from a remote server

The following remove a directory in a remote FTP server.

var rmdirResponse = ftpClient->rmdir("<The directory path>");
if (rmdirResponse is error) {
    io:println("Error occured in removing directory.", rmdirResponse); 
    return;
}

###FTP Listener

The ftp:Listener is used to listen to a remote FTP location and trigger a WatchEvent type of event when new files are added to or deleted from the directory. The fileResource function is invoked when a new file is added and/or deleted.

An FTP listener endpoint is defined using the mandatory parameters protocol, host and path. Authentication configuration can be done using secureSocket and polling interval can be configured using pollingInterval. Default polling interval is 60 seconds.

The fileNamePattern parameter can be used to define the type of files the FTP listener endpoint will listen to. For instance, if the listener gets invoked for text files, the value (.*).txt can be given for the config.

Creating a listener

The FTP Listener can be used to listen to a remote directory. It will keep listening to the specified directory and periodically notify on file addition and deletion.

import ballerina/ftp;
import ballerina/log;

listener ftp:Listener remoteServer = new({
    protocol: ftp:FTP,
    host: "<The FTP host>",
    secureSocket: {
        basicAuth: {
            username: "<The FTP username>",
            password: "<The FTP passowrd>"
        }
    },
    port: <The FTP port>,
    path: "<The remote FTP direcotry location>",
    pollingInterval: <Polling interval>,
    fileNamePattern: "<File type>"
});

service ftpServerConnector on remoteServer {
    resource function onFileChange(ftp:WatchEvent fileEvent) {

        foreach ftp:FileInfo addedFile in fileEvent.addedFiles {
            log:printInfo("Added file path: " + addedFile.path);
        }
        foreach string deletedFile in fileEvent.deletedFiles {
            log:printInfo("Deleted file path: " + deletedFile);
        }
    }
}

For information on the operations, which you can perform with this module, see the below Functions. For examples on the usage of the operation, see the Execute FTP Operations Example.

fields.name: path
fields.description: Relative file path for newly added file

fields.name: lastModifiedTimestamp
fields.description: Last modified timestamp of the file in UNIX Epoch time

fields.name: isFolder
fields.description: Whether the file is a folder or not

fields.name: isFile
fields.description: Whether the file is a file or not

fields.name: pathDecoded
fields.description: The normalized absolute path of this file, within its file system

fields.name: publicURIString
fields.description: The receiver as a URI String for public display

fields.name: isWritable
fields.description: Whether this file can be written to

fields.name: depth
fields.description: The depth of this file name, within its file system

fields.name: rootURI
fields.description: The root URI of the file system this file belongs to

fields.name: friendlyURI
fields.description: A "friendly path", this is a path without a password

records.name: FileInfo
records.description: This provides metadata information for newly added files.

fields.name: filePath
fields.description: Path of the file to create/append to

fields.name: isFile
fields.description: True if input type is a file

fields.name: fileContent
fields.description: The content read from the input file, if the input is a file

fields.name: textContent
fields.description: The input content, for other input types

fields.name: compressInput
fields.description: If true, input will be compressed before upload

records.name: InputContent
records.description: Provides configuration for the input given for FTP put and append operations

fields.name: fileNamePattern
fields.description: File name pattern that event need to trigger

fields.name: pollingInterval
fields.description: Periodic time interval to check new update

fields.name: privateKey
fields.description: Configures the private key to be used

records.name: SecureSocket
records.description: Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote FTP server

fields.name: addedFiles
fields.description: Array of FileInfo that represents newly added files

fields.name: deletedFiles
fields.description: Array of string that contains deleted file names

records.name: WatchEvent
records.description: This represents the latest status change of the server from the last status change.

returnParameters.description: A ReadableByteChannel that represents the data source to the resource or an error if failed to establish communication with the FTP server or read the resource

remoteMethods.name: get
remoteMethods.description:
The get() function can be used to retrieve file content from a remote resource.

 io:ReadableByteChannel|error channel = client->get(path);

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content to be written to the file in server

returnParameters.description: An error if failed to establish communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: append
remoteMethods.description:
The append() function can be used to append content to an existing file in an FTP server.

 error? response = client->append(path, channel);

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content to be written to the file in server

parameters.name: compressInput
parameters.description: True if file should be compressed before uploading

returnParameters.description: An error if failed to establish communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: put
remoteMethods.description:
The put() function can be used to add a file to an FTP server.

 error? response = client->put(path, channel);

returnParameters.description: An error if failed to establish communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: mkdir
remoteMethods.description:
The mkdir() function can be used to create a new direcotry in an FTP server.

 error? response = client->mkdir(path);

returnParameters.description: An error if failed to establish communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: rmdir
remoteMethods.description:
The rmdir() function can be used to delete an empty directory in an FTP server.

 error? response = client->rmdir(path);

returnParameters.description: An error if failed to establish communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: rename
remoteMethods.description:
The rename() function can be used to rename a file or move to a new location within the same FTP server.

 error? response = client->rename(origin, destination);

returnParameters.description: The file size in bytes or an error if failed to establish communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: size
remoteMethods.description:
The size() function can be used to get the size of a file resource.

 int|error response = client->size(path);

returnParameters.description: An array of file names or an error if failed to establish communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: list
remoteMethods.description:
The list() function can be used to get the file name list in a given folder.

 ftp:FileInfo[]|error response = client->list(path);

returnParameters.description: true if given resource is a direcotry or an error if failed to establish communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: isDirectory
remoteMethods.description:
The isDirectory() function can be used to check if a given resource is a direcotry.

 boolean|error response = client->isDirectory(path);

returnParameters.description: An error if failed to establish communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: delete
remoteMethods.description:
The delete() function can be used to delete a file from an FTP server.

 error? response = client->delete(path);

returnParameters.description: A ReadableByteChannel that represents the data source to the resource or an error if failed to establish communication with the FTP server or read the resource

The delete() function can be used to delete a file from an FTP server.

methods.description:
Stops consuming messages and detaches the service from the ftp:Listener.

methods.description:
Stops the ftp:Listener forcefully.

methods.description:
Stops the ftp:Listener gracefully.
